metadata.title: CVE-2017-14442 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the BMP imagerendering functionality of SDL2_image-2.0.2. A specially crafted BMP imagecan cause a stack overflow resulting in code execution. An attacker candisplay a specially crafted image to trigger this vulnerability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14442` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsdl2-image-2.0-0 - 2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

libsdl-image1.2 - 1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libsdl2-image package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.1+dfsg-2+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
sdl-image1.2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.12-5+deb9u1build0.16.04.1').
